AI Resources at SMU: Overview

Introduction to Artificial Intelligence (AI) at SMU

  • Generative AI Tools for SMU Researchers
    Slides from January 2026 workshop
  • Generative AI Tools for SMU Researchers
    Panopto recording of Jan 2026 workshop

Generative AI Resources

Generative AI (GenAI) is a type of artificial intelligence that produces content such as text, images, or music. GenAI relies an large datasets in order to generate content.

  • Research with Generative AI Tools
    To learn more about using Generative AI Tools in your scholarship, see this guide.
  • Research Assignment Design: Generative AI
    Suggestions for designing research assignments with generative AI in mind
  • AI & Information Literacy
    Student learning outcomes and suggestions for activities to teach AI literacy
  • Generative AI Canvas Tutorials
    Tutorials on the basics of generative AI, thinking critically about it and knowing how it works
  • CTE Resources on Generative AI and ChatGPT
    SMU Center for Teaching Excellence Resources on Generative AI and ChatGPT.

High-Performance Computing Resources

SMU offers several high-performance computing options for advanced computational research (including ML and AI projects), such as SuperPOD and M3 HPC.

  • High Performance Computing (HPC)
    The SMU NVIDIA DGX SuperPOD is a HPC cluster specifically tailored to meet the demands of AI research.
  • Oâ€™Donnell Data Science and Research Computing Institute (ODSRCI)
    ODCRCI serves as a gateway to SMU's high performance computing environment. The ODSRCI also performs interdisciplinary research in HPC, AI/ML, and future computing technologies. Additionally, the ODSRCI offers training tutorials and workshops in HPC implementation of data science and AI/ML applications and workflows.
  • OIT Research Services
    The Office of Information Technologyâ€™s Research Services team provides dedicated consultative and project resources for research and teaching involving data science tools and practices across disciplines.
